trans-unit.source: , but it should be noted that they will be clobbered by any options in the setup.cfg file.
trans-unit.target: , but it should be noted that they will be clobbered by any options in the setup.cfg file.

trans-unit.source: , followed by any number of whitespace separated wildcard patterns (or actual filenames relative to the package). Under this scheme, whitespace is not allowed in the patterns themselves.
trans-unit.target: , followed by any number of whitespace separated wildcard patterns (or actual filenames relative to the package). Under this scheme, whitespace is not allowed in the patterns themselves.

trans-unit.source: , for example. Furthermore, not all use cases required by some of the packages I support are fully supported by distutils2 yet. Hopefully they will be eventually, either through the distutils2 core or through extensions. But in the meantime d2to1 will try to keep up with the state of the art and “best practices” for distutils2 distributions, while adding support in areas that it’s lacking.
trans-unit.target: , for example. Furthermore, not all use cases required by some of the packages I support are fully supported by distutils2 yet. Hopefully they will be eventually, either through the distutils2 core or through extensions. But in the meantime d2to1 will try to keep up with the state of the art and “best practices” for distutils2 distributions, while adding support in areas that it’s lacking.

trans-unit.source: ./setup.py install
trans-unit.target: ./setup.py install

trans-unit.source: Added a [backwards_compat] section for setup.cfg for other options that are supported by setuptools/distribute, but that aren’t part of the distutils2 standard. So far the only options supported here are zip_safe and use_2to3. (Note: packaging does support a use-2to3 option to the build command, but if we tried to use that, distutils would not recognize it as a valid build option.)
trans-unit.target: Added a [backwards_compat] section for setup.cfg for other options that are supported by setuptools/distribute, but that aren’t part of the distutils2 standard. So far the only options supported here are zip_safe and use_2to3. (Note: packaging does support a use-2to3 option to the build command, but if we tried to use that, distutils would not recognize it as a valid build option.)

trans-unit.source: Added a few basic functional tests, along with an infrastructure to add more as needed. They can be run with nose and possibly with py.test though the latter hasn’t been tested.
trans-unit.target: Added a few basic functional tests, along with an infrastructure to add more as needed. They can be run with nose and possibly with py.test though the latter hasn’t been tested.

trans-unit.source: Added a tox.ini (frankly I thought there already was one).
trans-unit.target: 添加了一个 tox.ini(坦白说,我以为已经有了)。

trans-unit.source: Added support for setuptools entry points in an
trans-unit.target: 增加了对设置工具入口点的支持。

trans-unit.source: Added support for the
trans-unit.target: 增加了对

trans-unit.source: Added support for the Keywords metadata field via the keywords option in the
trans-unit.target: 已添加了对关键字元数据字段的支持,通过关键字选项在

trans-unit.source: Added support for the extra_files option of the
trans-unit.target: 增加了对函数的 extra_files 选项的支持。

trans-unit.source: Added support for the new (and presumably final) extension section format used by packaging. In this format, extensions should be specified in config sections of the format
trans-unit.target: 增加了对打包使用的新的(大概是最终的)扩展部分格式的支持。在这种格式中,扩展部分应该在格式的配置部分指定。

trans-unit.source: Added support for the new syntax used by packaging for the package_data option (which is deprecated in packaging in favor of the resources system, but still supported). The new syntax is like:
trans-unit.target: 增加了对打包中package_data选项的新语法的支持(在打包中已经废弃,改为资源系统,但仍然支持)。新的语法是这样的。

trans-unit.source: Added support for the tests_require setup argument from setuptools via the [backwards_compat] section in setup.cfg.
trans-unit.target: 通过 setup.cfg 中的 [backwards_compat]部分增加了对 setuptools 中 tests_require 设置参数的支持。

trans-unit.source: Adds (slightly naive) support for PEP 345-style version specifiers in requires-dist (environment markers not supported yet)
trans-unit.target: 在 requires-dist 中增加了对 PEP 345 风格的版本说明符的支持(略显天真)(环境标记尚不支持)。

trans-unit.source: Adds nominal Python3 support
trans-unit.target: Adiciona suporte nominal Python3

trans-unit.source: Adds preliminary support for custom compilers specified in the ‘compilers’ option under the [global] section in setup.cfg. This functionality doesn’t exist in distutils/setuptools/distribute, so adding support for it is a flaming hack. It hasn’t really been tested beyond seeing that the custom compilers come up in
trans-unit.target: Adds preliminary support for custom compilers specified in the ‘compilers’ option under the [global] section in setup.cfg. This functionality doesn’t exist in distutils/setuptools/distribute, so adding support for it is a flaming hack. It hasn’t really been tested beyond seeing that the custom compilers come up in

trans-unit.source: Adds support for command pre/post-hooks. Warning: this monkey-patches distutils.dist.Distribution a little bit… :(
trans-unit.target: Adds support for command pre/post-hooks. Warning: this monkey-patches distutils.dist.Distribution a little bit… :(

trans-unit.source: Adds support for custom command classes specified in the ‘commands’ option under the [global] section in setup.cfg
trans-unit.target: Adds support for custom command classes specified in the ‘commands’ option under the [global] section in setup.cfg

trans-unit.source: Adds support for the data_files option under [files]. Though this is considered deprecated and may go away at some point, it can be useful in the absence of resources support
trans-unit.target: 增加对 [files]下的 data_files 选项的支持。虽然这被认为是过时的,可能会在某些时候消失,但在没有资源支持的情况下,它可能是有用的。

trans-unit.source: Adds zest.releaser entry points for updating the version number in a setup.cfg file; only useful if you use zest.releaser–otherwise harmless (might eventually move this functionality out into a separate product)
trans-unit.target: Adds zest.releaser entry points for updating the version number in a setup.cfg file; only useful if you use zest.releaser–otherwise harmless (might eventually move this functionality out into a separate product)

trans-unit.source: Allows using distutils2-like setup.cfg files for a package's metadata with a distribute/setuptools setup.py
Caveats
trans-unit.target: 注意事项

trans-unit.source: Changes
trans-unit.target: 变化

trans-unit.source: Does not support distutils2 resources, and probably won’t since it relies heavily on the sysconfig module only available in Python 3.2 and up. This is one area in which d2to1 should really be seen as a transitional tool. I don’t really want to include a backport like distutils2 does. In the meantime, package_data and data_files may still be used under the [files] section of setup.cfg.
trans-unit.target: Does not support distutils2 resources, and probably won’t since it relies heavily on the sysconfig module only available in Python 3.2 and up. This is one area in which d2to1 should really be seen as a transitional tool. I don’t really want to include a backport like distutils2 does. In the meantime, package_data and data_files may still be used under the [files] section of setup.cfg.

trans-unit.source: Fixed a KeyError when the distribution does not have any custom commands specified
trans-unit.target: 修正了当发行版没有指定任何自定义命令时出现的 KeyError。

trans-unit.source: Fixed a bug in DefaultGetDict where it didn’t actually save the returned default in the dictionary–so any command options would get lost
trans-unit.target: Fixed a bug in DefaultGetDict where it didn’t actually save the returned default in the dictionary–so any command options would get lost

trans-unit.source: Fixed a bug in the exception formatting when exceptions occur in setup.cfg handling.
trans-unit.target: 修正了setup.cfg处理中出现异常时异常格式的错误。

trans-unit.source: Fixed a bug in the extra-files supported added in 0.2.8. Makes sure that monkey-patches can’t be installed more than once and that the log reference is properly encapsulated.
trans-unit.target: Fixed a bug in the extra-files supported added in 0.2.8. Makes sure that monkey-patches can’t be installed more than once and that the log reference is properly encapsulated.

trans-unit.source: Fixed a bug where not enough newlines were inserted between description files
trans-unit.target: 修正了一个在描述文件之间没有插入足够的换行符的错误。

trans-unit.source: Fixed a corner case where depending on the order of events when installing multiple packages (i.e. when installing packages with dependencies, some of which might also use d2to1) we would end up calling the incorrect Distribution class (the patched version from setuptools, where d2to1 needs to get to the unpatched version from distutils for some cases).
trans-unit.target: 修正了在安装多个包时,根据事件顺序的不同,我们最终会调用不正确的Distribution类(从setuptools中得到的补丁版本,而d2to1在某些情况下需要从distutils中得到未打补丁的版本)。

trans-unit.source: Fixed a couple minor Python 3-specific issues. In particular the
trans-unit.target: 修正了几个Python 3特有的小问题。尤其是

trans-unit.source: Fixed a crash on projects that don’t have a description-file option
trans-unit.target: Fixed a crash on projects that don’t have a description-file option

trans-unit.source: Fixed a missing import that caused a misleading exception when setup.cfg is missing.
trans-unit.target: 修正了一个缺失的导入,当setup.cfg缺失时,会造成误导性的异常。

trans-unit.source: Fixed an unhelpful error message when a setup_hook fails to import
trans-unit.target: Corrigida uma mensagem de erro inútil quando um setup_hook não é importado

trans-unit.source: Fixed some bugs with installation on Python 3
trans-unit.target: 修正了Python 3上安装的一些错误

trans-unit.source: Fixed the self-installation–it did not work if a d2to1 version was not already installed, due to the use of
trans-unit.target: Fixed the self-installation–it did not work if a d2to1 version was not already installed, due to the use of

trans-unit.source: Fixes the ‘classifier’ option in setup.cfg
trans-unit.target: Fixes the ‘classifier’ option in setup.cfg

trans-unit.source: However, I did not want any of these projects to require distutils2 for installation yet–it is too unstable, and not widely installed. So projects should still be installable using the familiar
trans-unit.target: However, I did not want any of these projects to require distutils2 for installation yet–it is too unstable, and not widely installed. So projects should still be installable using the familiar

trans-unit.source: I’m currently in the progress of redoing the packaging of a sizeable number of projects. I wanted to use distutils2-like setup.cfg files for all these projects, as they will hopefully be the future, and I much prefer them overall to using an executable setup.py. So forward-support for distutils2 is appealing both as future-proofing, and simply the aesthetics of using a flat text file to describe a project’s metadata.
trans-unit.target: I’m currently in the progress of redoing the packaging of a sizeable number of projects. I wanted to use distutils2-like setup.cfg files for all these projects, as they will hopefully be the future, and I much prefer them overall to using an executable setup.py. So forward-support for distutils2 is appealing both as future-proofing, and simply the aesthetics of using a flat text file to describe a project’s metadata.

trans-unit.source: If no extension modules or entry points are defined in the setup.cfg, don’t clobber any extension modules/entry points that may be defined in setup.py.
trans-unit.target: If no extension modules or entry points are defined in the setup.cfg, don’t clobber any extension modules/entry points that may be defined in setup.py.

trans-unit.source: Improved handling of packages where the packages_root option is set. That is, the Python package is not directly in the root of the source tree, but is in some sub-directory. Now the packages_root directory is prepended to sys.path while processing the setup.cfg and running setup hooks.
trans-unit.target: 改进了对设置了 packages_root 选项的包的处理。也就是说,Python 包并不直接在源代码树的根目录下,而是在某个子目录下。现在,在处理 setup.cfg 和运行 setup 钩子时,packages_root 目录会被预输入 sys.path。

trans-unit.source: Improved hook imports to work better with namespace packages.
trans-unit.target: 改进了钩子的导入,以便更好地与命名空间包配合使用。

trans-unit.source: Included some miscellaneous hacks to keep d2to1 working, nominally, with Python 2.5 despite the broad move away from Python 2.5 support in the Python community. The d2to1 v0.2.x releases will be the last to continue Python 2.5 support, given that testing it has become more difficult (and the overhead is probably no longer worth it).
trans-unit.target: 包括一些杂七杂八的小技巧,以保持 d2to1 工作,名义上,与 Python 2.5 一起工作,尽管在 Python 社区中,Python 2.5 的支持被广泛放弃。d2to1 v0.2.x版本将是最后一个继续支持Python 2.5的版本,因为测试Python 2.5变得更加困难了 (而且可能已经不值得了)。

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: 介紹

trans-unit.source: It should also work fine if additional arguments are passed to
trans-unit.target: 如果传递额外的参数给

trans-unit.source: Made d2to1 able to use its own machinery to install itself
trans-unit.target: Fabricado d2to1 capaz de utilizar a sua própria maquinaria para se instalar

trans-unit.source: Made the call to pkg_resources.get_distribution() to set __version__ more robust, so that it doesn’t fail on, for example, VersionConflict errors
trans-unit.target: Made the call to pkg_resources.get_distribution() to set __version__ more robust, so that it doesn’t fail on, for example, VersionConflict errors

trans-unit.source: Not all features of distutils2 are supported yet. If something doesn’t seem to be working, it’s probably not implemented yet.
trans-unit.target: Not all features of distutils2 are supported yet. If something doesn’t seem to be working, it’s probably not implemented yet.

trans-unit.source: Note that it’s important to specify d2to1=True or else the d2to1 functionality will not be enabled. It is also possible to set d2to1=’some_file.cfg’ to specify the (relative) path of the setup.cfg file to use. But in general this functionality should not be necessary.
trans-unit.target: Note that it’s important to specify d2to1=True or else the d2to1 functionality will not be enabled. It is also possible to set d2to1=’some_file.cfg’ to specify the (relative) path of the setup.cfg file to use. But in general this functionality should not be necessary.

trans-unit.source: Note: distutils2 has been merged into the CPython standard library, where it is now known as ‘packaging’. This project was started before that change was finalized. So all references to distutils2 should also be assumed to refer to packaging.
trans-unit.target: Note: distutils2 has been merged into the CPython standard library, where it is now known as ‘packaging’. This project was started before that change was finalized. So all references to distutils2 should also be assumed to refer to packaging.

trans-unit.source: Rationale
trans-unit.target: 理由

trans-unit.source: Reimplemented command hooks without monkey-patching and more reliably in general (though it’s still a flaming hack). The previous monkey patch-based solution would break if d2to1 were entered multiple times, which could happen in some scenarios
trans-unit.target: Reimplemented command hooks without monkey-patching and more reliably in general (though it’s still a flaming hack). The previous monkey patch-based solution would break if d2to1 were entered multiple times, which could happen in some scenarios

trans-unit.source: Renamed ‘setup_hook’ to ‘setup_hooks’ as is now the case in the packaging module. Added support for multiple setup_hooks
trans-unit.target: Renamed ‘setup_hook’ to ‘setup_hooks’ as is now the case in the packaging module. Added support for multiple setup_hooks

trans-unit.source: Replaced
trans-unit.target: 已更换

trans-unit.source: Supports Python 3 natively without 2to3. This makes Python 3 testing of d2to1 easier to support.
trans-unit.target: 原生支持Python 3,无需2to3。这使得Python 3对d2to1的测试更容易支持。

trans-unit.source: The requires-dist option in setup.cfg is implemented through the distribute/setuptools install_requires option, rather than the broken “requires” keyword in normal distutils.
trans-unit.target: The requires-dist option in setup.cfg is implemented through the distribute/setuptools install_requires option, rather than the broken “requires” keyword in normal distutils.

trans-unit.source: Though version 0.1.2 worked in Python3, use_2to3 wasn’t added to the setup.py so 2to3 had to be run manually

trans-unit.source: d2to1 (the ‘d’ is for ‘distutils’) allows using distutils2-like setup.cfg files for a package’s metadata with a distribute/setuptools setup.py script. It works by providing a distutils2-formatted setup.cfg file containing all of a package’s metadata, and a very minimal setup.py which will slurp its arguments from the setup.cfg.
trans-unit.target: d2to1 (the ‘d’ is for ‘distutils’) allows using distutils2-like setup.cfg files for a package’s metadata with a distribute/setuptools setup.py script. It works by providing a distutils2-formatted setup.cfg file containing all of a package’s metadata, and a very minimal setup.py which will slurp its arguments from the setup.cfg.

trans-unit.source: d2to1 requires a distribution to use distribute or setuptools. Your distribution must include a distutils2-like setup.cfg file, and a minimal setup.py script. For details on writing the setup.cfg, see the distutils2 documentation. A simple sample can be found in d2to1’s own setup.cfg (it uses its own machinery to install itself):
trans-unit.target: d2to1 requires a distribution to use distribute or setuptools. Your distribution must include a distutils2-like setup.cfg file, and a minimal setup.py script. For details on writing the setup.cfg, see the distutils2 documentation. A simple sample can be found in d2to1’s own setup.cfg (it uses its own machinery to install itself):
